channel.title: Tram animation!!
channel.description:
Hello! I looked at my new video of the tram and I think it's very good. However, one could still add a animation of the control lever located to the right of the display. In the mean time if any one level, the lever also switches to the front and comes back again. When the lever switch back and goes back first and then forward again. I hope you understand what I mean my English is not really good.
Bye

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Alcator
item.description:
Catz, Raw_bean: I understand. That’s why I was shocked by nated’s comment.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
The existence of the suggestion box doesn’t guarantee anything about the suggestions made in it being considered anyway. You could argue it exists only as a way to keep all the inevitable suggestions in one place simply to make the rest of the forum more useful, as much or more than for the reason of making it easy for devs to review and consider suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
but what if there is still a good suggestion that comes up that is easy to impliment and everyone loves it? We dont want to squeltch the creativity. do we? do we?

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Alcator
item.description:
natedgreat3:

With T-Minus 3 months before release, I’d just like to say we have tons of time and we are totally planning on implementing every single suggestion in this thread B)

I’d just like to say that it is common to post “We no longer accept any additional suggestions” when you no longer want to accept any suggestions.

Just like you would put a poster “Applications are now closed” on the door of a university assistant’s office if you wanted to prevent annoying “Would you take my application into consideration?” questions.

Keeping the Suggestions forum opened and then whining about how it annoys you when people suggest to you that you should drop the stupid Doom3 panel from the tram, when you only recently decided to let us know that you plan on using that stupid idea in this mod – that’s really quite hyppocritical (sorry for misspelling).

I became used to Raminator’s arrogant behavior, but why do you have to repeat it after him?

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
raw_bean:

For God’s sake, he was only joking, based on the title of the thread (90 days = three months, duh).

What makes you think I was serious, dude? I even placed a bet on another thread that the mod would be released this year. I have confidence in the team, don’t worry.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
Can I just add into this thread:
Some ideas from Doom3 are good, like the click to open door with the mouse cursor, but over use of that idea is just dry and boring. If it’s used only on the tram that will be great. I also disliked in doom3 how the edge of the cursor somehow moved out of the monitor and onto the casing surrounding it :fffuuu:

Read full topic

That’s a waste of company money.

BMRF has government funding. They have no need to use their own money for silly little gadgets.

make that a frappuccino with hazelnut syrup and I’m with ya.

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Sir_Mad_Hatter
item.description:
I agree, a cup holder is needed. Because when I’m riding an old freight cart in an underground facility, fighting aliens and marines who want me dead, my biggest worry is spilling my grande caramel cappuccino. Saving the world is one thing, but I want my caffeine fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Skaevola
item.description:
needs moar cupholder

The screen itself doesn’t really bother me, screens have been around for decades now and they could have run routine maintenance on the system any time in the past forty years to add screens to the trains. What bothers me is the fact that it appears to be a touchscreen. I mean, what the hell does a service tram need a touchscreen for? That’s a waste of company money.
Plus, I think if Valve meant to have that sort of button-pressing system in their game, they would have had it in Half-Life 2 or the episodes. It seems sort of gimmicky to me. And that’s without even mentioning the “Doom 3” implications

I’m not ocmplaining, I mean, I haven’t even played the game yet… just a little concerned.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: haxored
item.description:
HUD, brakes, and levers aside, I think if the devs truly want to nail it with the tram, they would focus on the turns. The repeated straight, turn, straight, turn really screams “I’m in a video game.” If they can find some way to make the turns smooth throughout, I’d be a happy camper.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!

item.description:
I always though a simple number / color panel would do.

3 - White?
2 - Green
1 - Yellow
0 - Red
R - Blue?

Alternitively:

3 - Green
2 - Yellow
1 - Red
0 - No Color (off)
R - Flashing Orange?

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
Medevilae:

I can think of a functional purpose: Emergency break in case the electronics in the train are somehow compromised. /thread

If it’s a break, then it needs to look different, and distinguishably an emergency break.
If it’s an emergency override control for speed, then it needs to display the words “Emergency Override.”

Otherwise, the lever should be removed and replaced with some other miscellaneous filler detail.

Read full topic

item.title: Tram animation!!
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Dillxn:

I’m confused why the lever even exists…

I always thought it was the speed control itself, as the other lever in the video wasn’t in the original. I just assumed that it didn’t move because the engine couldn’t support that. (Which it can’t with the code they had time to make)

Read full topic
